question: Which are the basin countries of the "Garonne River"?
explanation: The Garonne River is a 602-kilometer long river in southwest France and northern Spain. It flows from the central Spanish Pyrenees to the Gironde estuary at the French port of Bordeaux in the Atlantic Ocean. The critically endangered species of the European sea sturgeon, previously found on most coasts of Europe, has now become so rare that they only breed in the Garonne river basin in France.
